I have been to this restaurant many times for brunch and have always had good service and good food for a reasonable price. The ambiance is nice and the staff are friendly...until yesterday! Either the manager, chef, server or all of the above! must have had a big night out on Halloween as both the food preparation and service were extremely disappointing. 

Here is the list of reasons not to go back (in the order that they occurred):
1) We were seated outside on the sidewalk and ordered before several other groups arrived, yet we were the last ones to receive our food while 5 other tables were served ahead of us ordering similar dishes.
2) The waitress moved two guests to another table as she informed them that "that" table was reserved for her boyfriend - a nonpaying customer, WTF?!?
3) The same waitress waited on her boyfriend while paying little attention to the other guests.
4) Our food came out and one of the plates we ordered was Eggs Florentine - since when does Eggs Florentine come with gravy instead of hollandaise???? My girlfriend insisted it was no big deal but I insisted they take it back and remove it from our bill. The server tried to argue that it was hollandaise but when I told her to go ahead and try it and tell me what she thought it was she reluctantly took away the plate.
5) Another server brought us an order of french fries that we didn't order but we thought maybe they came with one of our lunches. We ate some and then he came back 5 minutes later and took them from us and said they were for the table next to us. He then put those same french fries that we had been eating on their table. Understandably, the table next to us did not want the food that we had been eating. So he moved them back to our table BUT added it to our bill.

Overall, this was a very disappointing experience and with so many great options in SF for brunch, don't let the charming sidewalk cafe and cool music sway you into spending your money here. You're better off going to a greasy spoon - at least you know what to expect.
author: Steve C.

description: Went to chouquet on saturday night, got there at 7.25pm and wanted to set menu at $31.95 that was served till 7.30pm.. the server had a table for us but we were asked to wait at the bar until the table was reset.About 10mn later she told us that the table was actually not available so we were offered a table outside(the front patio had been empty the entire time). once sat, we waited another 10mn for the menu..When i asked the srver about the set menu she told us that it was not available after 7.30pm.I guess it was our fault for not getting seated right away.We ordered the tomato/garlic soup (very good) and the veggie salad(that never came).When our entrees came i asked about the salad and was told that i had not ordered it ( even tough the server repeated my order including the salad). anyway the server offered to bring it  at no charge which we accepted and guess what! the salad never came again! so we forgot about it. the lamb shank was very small and extremely rich, the filet of beef was good but again small portion, no vegetable, served with fries. The dessert was good but again very rich( molten chocolat with banana crumbs)..We were charged for everything including coffee, having been in the restaurant business for 30 years i myself would have bought dessert,jump the corkcage fee or coffee to make it up for the salad.Overall i would not recommend chouquet if you are very hungry and do not expect the best service. No bartenders, no host, no bus boy but only 2 servers running the place on a saturday night.
author: Jacques R.

description: Good neighborhood French bistro at respectable prices without a wait or reservations. I had the mussels which came with a yummy side of fries. The soup of the day was a hearty potato puree made without cream (thank goodness). Nice place to dine with my honey on a chillax week night. I would have given them 4 stars except I noticed they were discriminatory on who they gave amuse bouche too.
author: Mama L.

description: Great food, horrible service. I took friends from NY here and was extremely disappointed. It was a slow night and even then, it took us over 2 hours to get our entrees. The waitress explained that she waited until we were done with our salads to put the order in. Of course she never checked if we were finished and our salad plates sat there for 20 minutes. The food was good but in this town, that isnt enough to bring me back.
author: Rachel B.

description: Not a bad place just wasn't blown over. A group of 8 went out for a bday and it took a while. Food was okay, but not much there. I got the prix fix menu and had the ahi. It was good, but only 3 little slices of tuna. Everyone else was happy with their meal choices. It was very loud, however. That was my biggest complaint. I had to really project in order to speak with people on the other side of the table. Cute place, however. Wait staff was informative, but they were overwhelmed. There were only 2 people working, and it was at capacity.
author: Erik B.

description: Went here for brunch.  The service was terrible.  Lots of staff doing nothing but ignoring diners trying to get their attention.  Food is decent but nothing special.  Many better options nearby.
author: Ingrid L.

description: A lovely choice for a leisurely weekend lunch. I went to Chouquet's for the first time last Saturday with a friend. It was a sunny day so many diners were enjoying the warm rays at the sidewalk tables. The ambiance inside was nice and cozy, although the tables may be a tad too close to each other. The location is great as other yelpers have mentioned because you can walk around Fillmore either before or after your meal. The food was v. good, we started off with 1/2 of the Effigham Oysters with mignonette mint/schallots  which were yummy (except for one that my friend ate which had what she described as a 'fishy' taste) though small.  The french bread they serve was very fresh, crusty on the outside and soft on the inside.  I had the Smoked Trout with fingerling potatoes & mache salad and my friend had the quiche lorraine with green salad.  I really enjoyed my salad, the fish was pink and looked much more like salmon than trout, but was nonetheless delicious. I tried a bite of the quiche and thought it was quite tasty, there is definitely cheese in it!  We were too full to get dessert although the chocolate fondant cake looked amazing...guess I'll have to go back for that!
author: Jessica H.

description: I absolutely loved that Lamb that everyone is ranting over. Sooooo yummie....The dessert was very delicious. I wasn't too crazy about the risotto. Service, very friendly
author: Owen S.

description: The service was excellent. All three courses came out quickly and the waitress came by to check on us at all the right times without making us feel rushed. The restaurant is very small, but has an intimate neighborhood feel. The food was good, but a little bit bland for French food. Of course, it's probably much healthier than most French food also.  Exceptional service and an intimate feel.
author: Ron B.

description:
We just had dinner at Chouquet's and wow.... it was the best French food we've had outside of France. And it's coming from a Frenchman!! I have been to La Folie and with all it's foofoo and high prices, I prefer Chouquet's for authentic French food.
The Hamachi Crudo, Baby shitake, lemon/chive essence appetizer was a wonderful starter (so refreshing and light yet very tasty).
We had the 7-hour braised shoulder of lamb with truffled mashed potatoes & Chanterelles  which was very good but the star of the night was the Rigatoni with Truffles, Chanterelles & Foie Gras. We just couldn't stop eating it. The sauce was amazing with lots of mushrooms and we finished the extra sauce with pieces of baguette at the end.  We ate so much that we had no room for dessert. We would go there again in a heart beat for French food (driving in from San Mateo!). Oh the waiters were very polite and constantly checked to see if we liked our food. It totally reminded me of a cute little restaurant in Paris :)
author: mojgan v.

description: Had brunch there. Nice enough place  but service is lousy. Food is nothing special.
author: carolina d.

description: i live in the area and was so excited when the new chef arrived from paris. So i went there the other night with friends and had a fabulous time. even though they were packed and we didn't have a reservation, the host still made an effort to accomodate us. The food was very good. We had the duck pastilla, the hawaiian ono (which was slightly dry but still very good), rossoto, smoked salmon and a dried tomatoe with goat cheese tarte. Everything was very good. I highly recommend going to chouquet!!
author: Abigail W.

description: We made a rez here for Thanksgiving dinner via opentable.com and it turned out to be lovely.  The menu was limited but the food was beautifully prepared and all quite tasty. Friendly wait staff, too. A different way to mark the holiday for us this year, but definitely a good choice.  Kind of pricey for a pretty simple meal, but again, worth it to relax in a quiet place.  Would definitely recommend it, probably for a special brunch.
author: Joan O.

description: Good, predictable fair bistro-sytle neighborhood restaurant.  Can get a burger for lunch too.  Friendly service.  A recent chef change has been an improvement for the dinner menu.
author: Ali T.

description: After all these reviews, I was *very* worried about going to this restaurant. I was terrified about the roaches and kept looking for anything suspect, but I have to say we had a wonderful dinner here. I ordered the tomato and goat cheese appetizer which was a bit greasy but tasty, and then the halibut which was really spectacular. I was so prepared to be disappointed and this place really delivered. Service was fine. This place has addressed its' problems and is now quite excellent.
author: D. T.

description: The prix fixe menu was superb! The service was excellent! Had a wonderful time!
author: Macky L.

description: Thursday evening Oct 14,2010 7:30pm : Had stopped at Kiehl's in Upper Fillmore and saw this intriguing little place.  Liked the name and decided to try it.  So disappointed.  My drink (coffee) was brought to me quickly but waited a long time for the entree, salmon. This was a narrow slice approx. 1.25" x 4.75" on a bed of mashed potatoes with peas&carrots. Uninspiring, less than generous but tasty because of the seasoned potatoes the salmon sat upon. Not worth $22.00.  It was salmon not halibut!  Should not have been more than $16-18. Bread basket was not brought until the time of the main course. 3 tiny slices of bread. Water was not brought till the end of the main course. I hadn't asked for it but wondered where it was all meal long.  Wondered if this was an attempt to clear my palate for dessert which they hoped I'd order. Service was as you can imagine slow.  Pleasant young girl but clearly disorganized and not a seasoned waiter. Will not be returning to this one.  So many other french bistros out there. With coffee and tax 26.83.  Way not worth it.
author: Anne N.

description: I cannot rate this as others have. Only ONE STAR as the review wont print without at least a star.   First, my girlfriend and I had a lunch reservation here.  It was my birthday!  The morning started out fantastic with a mani/pedi at Le Creme....wonderful!  Then off to Chouquets for a relaxing lunch and girl talk.  It was a very cold day and had rained too.  The temp outside was 41 and when we were seated it was about the same temp inside!  Other customers (only 3) were having lunch with their coats on!  As we sat at our table I said, "its so cold in here".  The "gentleman" said...."well, its cold outside too".  WHAT?  The ad in Yelp & Open Table says the "warm dining room".  YIKES!  It was not warm at all!  No heat and a very very rude person to boot.  I kindly said that its too cold to enjoy our lunch and that we were leaving.  OWNERS:  Please make your paying guests comfortable.  Guests will come back if the food is good and they have a nice dining experience.  Really...do you stay in a store or place of business longer than you have to when its absolutely freezing?  How about lunch or dinner in 41 degrees?  Too many "other" great places to eat with heat.   Due to the response we had, we will never eat here.  Never.
author: MELANIE W.

description: i had the spicy chicken....dry and not very good.  spot is nice for outdoor dining and the service was good and offered to change out the dish for something else.  will try it again, but the first go around was nothing spectacular.
author: Alisan M.

description: Location: A+ (On the corner right before Fillmore gets all Union-y but still up below Tully's and Jackson Fillmore, so there is always a bit of people watching traffic). Decor: A (for such a small space, they've actually done a lot - very European with the inside tables crammed sort of ass to elbows - *great* eavesdropping opportunities) Ambience: A- (I think it's still neighborhood-y so it's a combination of Clay Street theater goers, Pac Heights non-interest-only home owners, and interested passers-by-- a nice, albeit eclectic, mix). Food: B+ Definitely loved the frites (especially because they're called Frites!), but, as with most French places, they are woefully slim on the vegetarian options, with not so much as a listed entree for the carnivorously challenged.  The chef did say he could do something for me, which wasn't half bad, but on principle I can't say that it's a great veg dining option...brunch might be better...
author: Anjali K.

description: We brought a friend here for Sunday brunch and I haven't been this disappointed in the service of a restaurant in a very long time. They seemed annoyed as soon as we arrived, the snobby hostess reluctantly sat us at a dirty table. No one brought waters or silverware. After asking twice and not receiving the water, I got up to get it myself from the bar. I had to literally walk up to the waiter and ask him to take our drink order 20 minutes later. Clearly, he was really busy flirting and pulling up his shirt for another customer to see his hairy belly and didn't have the time. It took forever for him to come over to take our food order & then he forgot the third person's order. He never came back to check on us or how  our meal was once and no, we never got refills on our water either. Saying that the service sucked at this place is an understatement & it really put a damper on what was supposed to be a relaxing Sunday brunch. We left the loser waiter a 12 cent tip and that was ONLY because we didn't have exact change.
author: Mariam M.
